alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 1:56PM CDT until April 05 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Eastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 156 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Cowarts, or 9 miles north of Cottonwood, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Houston County, including the following locations... Gordon, Pansey, Crosby, Pearce, Enon, Lovetown, Wilson Mill, Avon, Barber and Chattahoochee SP. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
